channel.title: Thoughts on Bits, Bytes, Late Nights
channel.description: Recent content in Thoughts on Bits, Bytes, Late Nights

item.title: Ouroboros: An infinite AI content feed
item.description: The Gilded Age of content is nearly upon us, when generative AI models will create everything we consume. Everything will be perfectly curated to the viewer and generated on the fly right before your eyes. This post demonstrates how the pieces are nearly there and how easy it is to put an app like this together.

item.title: I Think, Therefore I Am Everything
item.description: As it turns out, our best explanation of physics proves that I’m the only real thing in this universe.

item.title: Prices Don't Go Down
item.description: With a new U.S. President looming on the horizon and the policies he’ll bring along, people are hoping for economic improvements, for some reason. Unfortunately, the harsh reality of modern economics suggests that prices must always go up.

item.title: How Does the System Make You Feel?
item.description: A quick essay that’s a long time coming on how the economic system of our world makes me feel. In a word: demoralized.

item.title: Irrational Economics
item.description: Why did I pay $12 for a water bottle at a festival? Why did you buy Tylenol over the generic brand of acetaminophen? Did you know it’s really easy to cause liver damage with acetaminophen? In this post, I laugh at the bad economic decisions we make as humans every day.

item.title: The Economics of Sustainability
item.description: A brief (by university standards) essay that ties together history, economics, philosophy, ethics, nutrition, and environmentalism to analyze the prosperity resulting from capitalism and industrialization in contrast to our hopes for a sustainable society.

item.title: Byte-sized Algorithms: Removing Duplicates
item.description: This is just some basic Leetcode-esque stuff I needed to do at work recently. It shouldn’t surprise or impress anyone who has thought about this before, but it was mildly interesting to think and write about.

item.title: Why NFTs Matter
item.description: It’s not about ape avatars, basketball highlights, or other digital trinkets. It’s about authentic relationships.

item.title: Newspeak in an AI-Driven World
item.description: Or: Stop trying to make everyone dumber, Outlook.

item.title: Do Self-Driving Cars Dream of Snitching?
item.description: A cynical (or realistic) take on how a utopian dream–autonomous, self-driving vehicles–can turn into a dystopian nightmare: the global snitching fleet of the future.

item.title: On Apple's Ecosystem
item.description: A short blurb on an interesting (if not worrying) possible byproduct if Apple is forced to release their iron grip on the AppStore.

item.title: Why Does 0.999... = 1?
item.description: A simple explanation for a fundamental mathematical truth.

item.title: On Pascal's Wager
item.description: A guy who took two philosophy courses questions the premises of a 400-year-old argument for the necessity of believing in God.

item.title: Minecraft and the Simulation Hypothesis
item.description: Are we reaching the hardware limitations of our simulated universe?

item.title: Contact Tracing Privacy
item.description: An analysis of Apple’s novel contact tracing protocol for COVID-19 though the lens of a paranoid privacy enthusiast.

item.title: Why (Not) Peer-to-Peer?
item.description: An overview of the Internet’s growth in the 2010s and some questions about what’s to come… With the current state of centralized content distribution, why aren’t we moving to a peer-to-peer model?

item.title: Optimizing Sessionless Sessions
item.description: Or, arriving at the rationale behind the existence of JSON Web Tokens in an extremely roundabout fashion.

item.title: Efficient P2P Broadcasting
item.description: A memory-less solution that minimizes extra message duplication.

item.title: Tracking Your Every Move
item.description: Or, abusing MAC addresses for fun and profit (well, no profit unless you’re a massive corporation or the government…).
